page.title: 09 The Chiltern Hospital
page.content: The Chiltern Hospital is a private hospital. It is set in eighteen acres of land and has retained a nine hole golf course from when it was a hotel. Part of the hospital which used to be an Abbey is one hundred and fifty years old, but most of it was built very recently. The hospital has been open for three years.It is licensed for sixty beds; it has three wards with a central nurse station on each ward. There are forty one single rooms and one room with four beds. Each ward has one sister and five nurses.The hospital director and director of nursing are in charge of the hospital. The sister and nurses are supported by catering and house keeping staff.They also have operating staff,porters,electricians,boilermen and people working in the grounds.
